text:
<optional title, max 6 words>

<setup: tense room, two characters, emotional turmoil>
<optional narration, ≤ 6 words>
Raskolnikov: “Your mind is unhinged, like Katerina’s.”

---

<setup: Raskolnikov’s intense gaze, Sonia’s fear>
<optional narration, ≤ 6 words>
Raskolnikov: “I bow to humanity’s suffering.”  
Sonia: “What are you doing to me?”  

---

<setup: Raskolnikov’s fervor, Sonia’s anguish>
Raskolnikov: “You’re not dishonorable; your suffering is great.”  
Sonia: “Why did you say that?”  
Raskolnikov: “You’ve betrayed yourself for nothing.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses his anguish over Sonia's suffering and self-betrayal, highlighting the contrast between her dishonor and the dignity of her suffering.
